Hi @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @AliDriverUK @UnderwaterMedia I reported this fish kill and suspected pollution incident to @EnvAgencySE. Their response was to ask @thameswater to investigate as the EA were under-resourced. Have you heard of this happening before?

RT @EnvAgencyNW: Works are progressing on the ¬£9m #Padiham Scheme with final ground investigations well underway 

This will help the team‚Ä¶
RT @JuliaBradbury: @Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency It's really not that tricky is it? Poo in rivers = bad. Poo not in rivers = go‚Ä¶
RT @EnvAgencyNW: We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating‚Ä¶

‚ÄúIn the long term, we all want to see the end of damaging pollution that storm overflows cause.‚Äù

The relevant EU clean water directive is from 1991. How long term is long term for @EnvAgency? https://t.co/HUSYQZxyKf
@Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency Today's news is a devastating indictment of the total inefficacy of the @EnvAgency in policing river pollution despite all the positive spin...
RT @Jamie_Woodward_: Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. How about applying some p‚Ä¶

@Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency It's really not that tricky is it? Poo in rivers = bad. Poo not in rivers = good. üôÑ

What about those in charge of this sorry mess @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency? https://t.co/VdoFZZFjtm

Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. How about applying some pressure @AndyBurnhamGM Manchester‚Äôs rivers are hit hard by this practice.
